battleship

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • battleship.Board
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Board
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Class for the User board where they place their ships and keep track of the ship's status. The board is made up of button type's and uses a 12x11 gridlayout.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Parker
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • fillHor

        public void fillHor(int x1,
                    int x2,
                    int y,
                    Ship tShip)
        Colors and marks the battlebuttons where a ship has been placed horizontally. Also checks for possible ship overlap.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the first x-coordniate
        x2 - the second x-coordniate
        y - the y-coordniate
        tShip - the ship that was placed

      • fillVert

        public void fillVert(int y1,
                     int y2,
                     int x,
                     Ship tShip)
        Colors and marks the battlebuttons where a ship has been placed vertically. Also checks for possible ship overlap.
        Parameters:
        y1 - the first y-coordniate
        y2 - the second y-coordniate
        x - the x-coordniate
        tShip - the ship that was placed

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip(int x1,
                         int x2,
                         int y1,
                         int y2,
                         Ship tShip)
        Method that determine whether the ship placement is valid and whether it was placed horizontally or vertically and directs it to the respective fill method.
        Parameters:
        x1 - the first x-coordinate
        x2 - the second x-coordinate
        y1 - the first y-coordinate
        y2 - the second y-coordinate
        tShip - the ship placed
        Returns:
        true if ship was placed, false if not

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Returns if player has placed their ships.
        Returns:
        boolean if the player is ready or not

      • setReady

        public void setReady(boolean ready)
        Set the ready boolean.
        Parameters:
        ready - if the player is ready or not

      • hitMiss

        public boolean hitMiss(int x,
                       int y)
        Checks if an opponent's guess is a hit or miss. Called by the GUI which gives the coordinates of the opponent's guess. Also checks if a ship has been sunk and if all ships are sunk. If all ships are sunk it sets lost to true.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate guessed by opponent
        y - y-coordinate guessed by opponent
        Returns:
        true if the guess was a hit, false if it was a miss

      • getShipCount

        public int getShipCount()
        Returns the current number of ships remaining.
        Returns:
        number of user ships left

      • setShipCount

        public void setShipCount(int shipCount)
        Set the number of ships the user has remaining.
        Parameters:
        shipCount - the number of user ships left.

      • isLost

        public boolean isLost()
        Whether or not the User has ships remaining.
        Returns:
        true is all ships are destroyed, false if not

      • setLost

        public void setLost(boolean lost)
        Set the lost boolean.
        Parameters:
        lost - True if lost, false if not

        public BattleButton getButton(int x,
                              int y)

        Parameters:

        y - y coordinate
        Returns:
        corresponding battlebutton
